se.natusoft.tools.fileeditor.internal

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.natusoft.tools.fileeditor.internal.Line

  • public class Line
extends Object
    This represents a line of text in a buffer and provides basic line editing functionality.

      • delete

        public Line delete(int start,
          int end)
        Deletes the part of the line between start and end where the end position is inclusive! This is different from TextBuilders delete() method and Strings substring() method where the end is exclusive.
        Parameters:
        start - Start to delete at this position.
        end - Delete up to including the character at this position.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • delete

        public Line delete(TextPos start,
          TextPos end)
        Deletes the part of the line between start and end where the end position is inclusive! This is different from TextBuilders delete() method and Strings substring() method where the end is exclusive.
        Parameters:
        start - Start to delete at this position.
        end - Delete up to including the character at this position.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • replace

        public boolean replace(String toReplace,
              String replaceWith,
              TextPos startingAt)
        Replaces part of a line with another text.
        Parameters:
        toReplace - The text to replace.
        replaceWith - The text to replace it with.
        startingAt - The column to start searching for 'toReplace'.
        Returns:
        true if anything was replaced.

      • replaceFirst

        public boolean replaceFirst(String toReplace,
                   String replaceWith)
        Replaces the first occurance of a text whitin the line with another text.
        Parameters:
        toReplace - The text to replace.
        replaceWith - The text to replace it with.
        Returns:
        true if any text was replaced.

      • replaceAll

        public boolean replaceAll(String toReplace,
                 String replaceWith)
        Replaces all occurances of a text within the line.
        Parameters:
        toReplace - The text to replace.
        replaceWith - The text to replace it with.
        Returns:
        true if anything was replaced.

      • subLine

        public Line subLine(int start,
           int end)
        Returns a sub line of this line. Please note that the end specification is inclusive!
        Parameters:
        start - The starting column of the sub string.
        end - The ending column of the substring. This is inclusive!

      • subLine

        public Line subLine(TextPos start,
           TextPos end)
        Returns a sub line of this line. Please note that the end specification is inclusive!
        Parameters:
        start - The starting column of the sub string.
        end - The ending column of the substring. This is inclusive!

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int column)
        Returns the character at the specified column.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to get the character at.

      • charAt

        public char charAt(TextPos column)
        Returns the character at the specified column.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to get the character at.

      • indexOf

        public TextPos indexOf(String text)
        Returns the index of the first match of the text within the line or -1 if not match was found.

        Please note that a match on the first character in the line will return 1 not 0!

        Parameters:
        text - The text to search for.

      • indexOf

        public TextPos indexOf(String text,
              TextPos fromColumn)
        Returns the index of the first match of the text within the line or -1 if not match was found.

        Please note that a match on the first character in the line will return 1 not 0!

        Parameters:
        text - The text to search for.
        fromColumn - The column to start searching from.

      • find

        public TextPos find(String regexp,
           TextPos fromColumn)
        Finds a regexp in the line starting at the specified position.

        Returns the column of the match if found or null otherwise.

        Parameters:
        regexp - The regular expression to search for.
        fromColumn - The column to start searching.

      • find

        public TextPos find(String regexp,
           TextPos fromColumn,
           String endAt)
        Finds a regexp in the line starting at the specified position.

        Returns the column of the match if found or null otherwise.

        Parameters:
        regexp - The regular expression to search for.
        fromColumn - The column to start searching.
        endAt - If not null a regexp that ends searching.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the line.

      • lastColumn

        public int lastColumn()
        Returns the last column of the line. This is just an alias for length()!

      • lastColumnNumber

        public TextPos lastColumnNumber()

      • columnWithinLimit

        public boolean columnWithinLimit(int column)
        Returns true if the specified column is whitin limit of the line.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to verify.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the line is empty.

      • matches

        public boolean matches(String regexp)
        Returns true if this line matches the specified regular expression.
        Parameters:
        regexp - The regular expression to match.

        Returns the line as a String.
